CatDescriptText: Mr. Jim Novotny, Box 5, Norvelt, Pa, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that we are spending too much money for foreign aid? Do you think that what we have spent has halted the spread of communism?" answer reads: "I don't know about spending too much, but I might say that Ike knows just what he is doing.  As to whether or not what we have spent has halted the spread of communism, I say who knows what would have happened if we hadn't helped various ountries (sic].  If there had not been any foreign aid, there might be more countries under Communist control."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jim Novotny wearing eyeglasses and plaid jacket with light colored handkerchief with monogrammed "N" in left breast pocket, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Baum Building sign
